description: Study flashcards generated from lecture transcript

cards.term: What event is considered the immediate trigger that started World War I?
cards.definition: The assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand on June 28, 1914, in Sarajevo. This event created a diplomatic crisis that escalated into global conflict when the Austrian heir was killed by a Serbian nationalist.

The heir to the Austro-Hungarian throne whose assassination on June 28, 1914, served as the immediate catalyst for World War I. He was killed by a Serbian nationalist in Sarajevo, creating the diplomatic crisis that led to the 'great war.'

cards.term: Where did the assassination that triggered World War I take place?
cards.definition: Sarajevo, the capital of Bosnia-Herzegovina. This location was significant because it was in a region with high ethnic tensions between Serbian nationalists and the Austro-Hungarian Empire.

cards.term: What was the nationality of the person who assassinated Archduke Franz Ferdinand?
cards.definition: Serbian nationalist. The assassination was carried out by someone supporting Serbian independence from Austro-Hungarian rule, which created the international incident that escalated into World War I.
